010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D65;
013
014import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
015
016import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
017
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * This class implements the CIELuv color space.
022 * See Sec. 14.2 of [1] for additional details.
023 * All component values are assumed to be in [0,1].
024 * Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ
025 * coordinates, i.e., without conversion to Java's D50-based profile 
026 * connection space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ 
027 * coordinates in Java's profile connection space.
028 * This is a singleton class with no public constructors,
029 * use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
030 * </p>
031 * <p>
032 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
033 * </p>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2022/09/01
037 */
038@SuppressWarnings("serial")
039public class LuvColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
040        
041        private static final LuvColorSpace instance = new LuvColorSpace();
042        
043        public static LuvColorSpace getInstance() {
044                return instance;
045        }
046                
047        // D65 reference white point:
048//      private static final double Xref = D65.getX();  // 0.950456
049//      private static final double Yref = D65.getY();  // 1.000000
050//      private static final double Zref = D65.getZ();  // 1.088754
051        private static final double[] XYZref = D65.getXYZ();
052        
053        private static final double uuref = fu(XYZref[0], XYZref[1], XYZref[2]); // u'_n
054        private static final double vvref = fv(XYZref[0], XYZref[1], XYZref[2]); // v'_n
055        
056        // chromatic adaptation objects:
057        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = new BradfordAdaptation(StandardIlluminant.D65, StandardIlluminant.D50);
058        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = new BradfordAdaptation(StandardIlluminant.D50, StandardIlluminant.D65);
059        
060        /**
061         * Constructor.
062         */
063        private LuvColorSpace() {
064                super(TYPE_Lab,3);
065        }
066        
067        // XYZ50->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D50)
068        /**
069         * {@inheritDoc}
070         * <p>
071         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) assumes that 
072         * the specified color coordinate is in D50-based XYZ space (with components in [0,1]).
073         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
074         * </p>
075         */
076        @Override
077        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
078                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
079                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
080        }
081        
082        // XYZ65->CIELuv: returns Luv values from XYZ (relative to D65)
083        /**
084         * Converts color points in D65-based XYZ space to CIELuv coordinates.
085         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])}.
086         * @param XYZ65 a color in D65-based XYZ space (components in [0,1])
087         * @return the associated CIELuv color
088         */
089        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {    
090                double X = XYZ65[0];
091                double Y = XYZ65[1];    
092                double Z = XYZ65[2];
093                double YY = f1(Y / XYZref[1]);          // Y'
094                double uu = fu(X,Y,Z);          // u'
095                double vv = fv(X,Y,Z);          // v'
096                float L = (float)(116.0 * YY - 16.0);           //L*
097                float u = (float)(13 * L * (uu - uuref));       //u*
098                float v = (float)(13 * L * (vv - vvref));       //v*
099                return new float[] {L, u, v};
100        }
101        
102        // CIELab->XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Luv
103        /**
104         * {@inheritDoc}
105         * <p>
106         * Note: This implementation (required by {@link ColorSpace}) converts a
107         * CIELuv color to a color coordinate in D50-based XYZ space.
108         * See also {@link #toCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
109         * </p>
110         */
111        @Override
112        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Luv) {
113                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
114                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
115        }
116        
117        /**
118         * Converts the specified CIELuv color to D65-based XYZ coordinates.
119         * @param Luv CIELuv color
120         * @return the associated D65-based XYZ coordinates
121         */
122        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Luv) {
123                double L = Luv[0];
124                double u = Luv[1];
125                double v = Luv[2];
126                float Y = (float) (XYZref[1] * f2((L + 16) / 116.0));
127                double uu = (L < 0.00001) ? uuref : u / (13 * L) + uuref; // u'
128                double vv = (L < 0.00001) ? vvref : v / (13 * L) + vvref; // v'
129                float X = (float) (Y * ((9*uu)/(4*vv)));
130                float Z = (float) (Y * ((12 - 3 * uu - 20 * vv) / (4 * vv)));
131                float[] XYZ65 = new float[] {X, Y, Z};
132                return XYZ65;
133        }
134        
135        //sRGB->CIELuv
136        /**
137         * Transforms a sRGB color value to a CIELuv color.
138         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#fromRGB(float[])} assuming
139         * D65-based sRGB color coordinates.
140         * Note that sRGB values are assumed to be in [0,1] (see
141         * {@link RgbUtils#normalize(int...)} for conversion from [0,255] int-values).
142         * @param srgb a sRGB color (D65-based)
143         * @return the associated CIELuv color
144         */
145        @Override
146        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
147                float[] XYZ65 = sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance().toCIEXYZ(srgb);
148                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
149        }
150        
151        //CIELuv->sRGB
152        /**
153         * Transforms a CIELuv color value to a sRGB color
154         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#toRGB(float[])} assuming 
155         * D65-based sRGB color coordinates.
156         * Note that the returned RGB values are in [0,1] (see
157         * {@link RgbUtils#unnormalize(float[])} for conversion to [0,255] int-values).
158         * @param Luv a CIELuv color
159         * @return sRGB coordinates (D65-based)
160         */
161        @Override
162        public float[] toRGB(float[] Luv) {
163                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Luv);
164                float[] srgb = sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance().fromCIEXYZ(XYZ65);
165                return srgb;
166        }
167        
168        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
169        
170        private static final double epsilon = 216.0/24389;
171        private static final double kappa = 841.0/108;
172        
173        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
174        private double f1 (double c) {
175                return (c > epsilon) ? Math.cbrt(c) : (kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
176        }
177        
178        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
179        private double f2 (double c) {
180                final double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
181                return (c3 > epsilon) ? c3 : (c - 16.0 / 116) / kappa;
182        }
183        
184        private static double fu (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
185                // fails if 0.001 is used!
186                return (X < 0.00001) ? 0 : (4 * X) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
187        }
188        
189        private static double fv (double X, double Y, double Z) { // X,Y,Z must be positive
190                return (Y < 0.00001) ? 0 : (9 * Y) / (X + 15 * Y + 3 * Z);
191        }
192
193}
